original: Lund, Karl Gustaf, överingenjör, Varberg, f. 22/7/93 i Hille, Gävleb. 1., av brukstj :m. Ferdinand L. o. Maria Andersson. G. 36 m. Sigrid Johansson. Barn: Ingvar f. 38, Lennart 42. — Ex. v. bergssk. i Filipstad 17, spec:-stud. v. KTH (B) 20-22, stud. v. me-tallogr. inst. o. Sthlms högsk. 21-22. Kemist v. Strömsnäs Järnverks A-B, Degerfors, 18-20, metallurg o. kemist v. Westinghouse Electric & Manuf. Co., East Pittsburgh, Pa, USA, 23-26 o. 28-29, chefsmetallurg v. Laclede Steel^Co., Ahon, 111., USA, 27, hytt-o. stålv.ing. v. A-B Iggesunds Bruk 29-31, platschef v. Gunnebo Bruks Nya A-B, Varbergsverket, sed. 31. Led. av drätselkamm., v. ordf. v. ekonomi-avd., suppl. i styr. f. elverket, huv:-man i Varbergs Sparbank, arb :giv. repr. i länsarb:ndns kretsråd, led. av styr. f. Varbergs luftsk ifören., sekr. i Varbergs högerfören., ordfs i järnv. sjukkassa o. Plant :sällsk. Småfågl. Vänner. Res. t. Tyskl. 21, 2^ 23, 30 o. 36, Danm., Tjeckoslov. 21, 22, 23, Österr. 21, USA 23-29. Skr.: Some fundamental factors for obtaining sharp thermal curves (Träns. Am. Soc. for Steel Treating, tills. m. C. Benedicks o. W. H. Dearden 25), Nutida fabrikation av sågblad, sågklingor o. maskinknivar (Trävaruind. 31). Hob-bies: jakt o. fiske.
translated: Lund, Karl Gustaf, Chief Engineer, Varberg, born on July 22, 1893 in Hille, Gävleborg County, the first son of factory worker Ferdinand L. and Maria Andersson. Married in 1936 to Sigrid Johansson. Children: Ingvar, born in 1938, Lennart, born in 1942. Former student at the Mining School in Filipstad in 1917, specialized studies at the Royal Institute of Technology (B) from 1920 to 1922, studied at the Metallurgical Institute and Stockholm University from 1921 to 1922. Worked as a chemist at Strömsnäs Ironworks A-B, Degerfors, from 1918 to 1920, metallurgist and chemist at Westinghouse Electric & Manufacturing Co., East Pittsburgh, PA, USA, from 1923 to 1926 and 1928 to 1929, Chief Metallurgist at Laclede Steel Co., Ahon, IL, USA, in 1927, furnace and steelworks engineer at Iggesunds Bruk A-B from 1929 to 1931, site manager at Gunnebo Bruks Nya A-B, Varbergsverket since 1931. Member of the municipal finance committee, deputy chairman of the economic department, substitute board member for the power plant, chairman of Varbergs Sparbank, employer representative in the county labor council, board member of Varbergs Air Defense Association, secretary of Varbergs Right Society, chairman of the railway health insurance fund and Plant's Society for Small Bird Friends. Traveled to Germany in 1921, 1923, 1930, and 1936, Denmark, Czechoslovakia in 1921, 1922, 1923, Austria in 1921, and the USA from 1923 to 1929. Writings: Some fundamental factors for obtaining sharp thermal curves (published with C. Benedicks and W.H. Dearden in Transactions of the American Society for Steel Treating, 1925), Contemporary manufacturing of saw blades, saw blades, and machine knives (Timber Industry, 1931). Hobbies: hunting and fishing.

structured.name: Karl Gustaf Lund

memberOf.name: Plant's Society for Small Bird Friends

structured.description: Karl Gustaf Lund was a Swedish Chief Engineer born on July 22, 1893, in Hille, Gävleborg County. He was the first son of Ferdinand L., a factory worker, and Maria Andersson. Karl married Sigrid Johansson in 1936, and they had two children named Ingvar (born 1938) and Lennart (born 1942). Karl had a bachelor's degree in engineering from the KTH Royal Institute of Technology. He worked as a chemist at Strömsnäs Järnverks A-B, Westinghouse Electric & Manuf. Co., and A-B Iggesunds Bruk. Later, Karl became the site manager at Gunnebo Bruks Nya A-B, Varbergsverket, where he served since 1931. He was also actively involved in various organizations, including the Municipal Finance Committee, Varbergs Sparbank, Varbergs Air Defense Association, Varbergs Right Society, Railway Health Insurance Fund, and Plant's Society for Small Bird Friends. Karl had hobbies such as hunting and fishing.
